ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the theoretically relevant field of research for a measure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cardiovascular; pertaining to the heart or blood vessels.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the heart or blood vessels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

Concepts.definition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (dye-a-BEE-teez) A disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood. As a result, the level of sugar in the blood is too high. This disease occurs when the body does not produce enough insulin or does not use it properly.

Concepts.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

PermissibleValues.value: Education, Training, and or Career Development
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Education Training And Or Occupation Development

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Education Training And Or Occupation Development
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The activities of educating or instructing or teaching; activities that impart knowledge or skill.:To teach with hands-on experience:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The principal activity that a person does to earn money.:The act of improving by expanding or enlarging or refining.

Concepts.definition: The activities of educating or instructing or teaching; activities that impart knowledge or skill.
To teach with hands-on experience
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The principal activity that a person does to earn money.
The act of improving by expanding or enlarging or refining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A syndrome resulting from the acquired deficiency of cellular immunity caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). It is characterized by the reduction of the Helper T-lymphocytes in the peripheral blood and the lymph nodes. Symptoms include generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, weight loss, and chronic diarrhea. Patients with AIDS are especially susceptible to opportunistic infections (usually pneumocystis carinii pneumonia, cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections, tuberculosis, candida infections, and cryptococcosis), and the development of malignant neoplasms (usually non-Hodgkin lymphoma and Kaposi sarcoma). The human immunodeficiency virus is transmitted through sexual contact, sharing of contaminated needles, or transfusion of contaminated blood.

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A syndrome resulting from the acquired deficiency of cellular immunity caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). It is characterized by the reduction of the Helper T-lymphocytes in the peripheral blood and the lymph nodes. Symptoms include generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, weight loss, and chronic diarrhea. Patients with AIDS are especially susceptible to opportunistic infections, tuberculosis, candida infections, and cryptococcosis), and the development of malignant neoplasms (usually non-Hodgkin lymphoma and Kaposi sarcoma). The human immunodeficiency virus is transmitted through sexual contact, sharing of contaminated needles, or transfusion of contaminated blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person's overall psychological and emotional condition. Good mental health is a state of well-being in which a person is able to cope with everyday events, think clearly, be responsible, meet challenges, and have good relationships with others.

Concepts.definition: The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The science of food, the nutrients and other substances contained therein, their action, interaction, and balance in relation to health and disease.

Concepts.definition: The science of food, the nutrients and other substances contained therein, their action, interaction, and balance in relation to health and disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The promotion and maintenance of physical and mental health in the work environment.

Concepts.definition: The identification and control of risks and hazards in the workplace to establish and maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc.

Concepts.definition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A form of physical intimacy that can be directed to reproduction (one possible goal of sexual intercourse) and/or to enjoying the body of someone else; activities associated with sexual intercourse.

Concepts.definition: Behaviors involved with sexual arousal and/or intercourse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural and periodic state of rest during which  consciousness of the world is suspended.

Concepts.definition: A natural and periodic state of rest during which consciousness of the world is suspended.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe.

Concepts.definition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with deep, often religious, feelings and beliefs, including a person's sense of peace, purpose, connection to others, and beliefs about the meaning of life.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with deep, often religious, feelings and beliefs, including a person's sense of peace, purpose, connection to others, and beliefs about the meaning of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus.

Concepts.definition: The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Concepts.definition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
